alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 6:57AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Randolph County through 730 AM CDT... At 656 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wedowee, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wedowee, Lake Wedowee, Woodland, Morrison Cross Roads, Tennant, Newell, R.L. Harris Dam, Big Springs, Ofelia, Rock Stand and Napoleon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
